rules: Rule1: Provided that the king secures an alliance with the council, it is not the case that the king loses the support of the council.
Rule2: Whenever the realm experiences a period of peace lasting a decade, the king does not receive tribute from the vassal.
Rule3: If the realm experiences a period of prosperity lasting a decade, then the realm experiences a period of peace lasting a decade.
Rule4: Either the realm experiences a period of prosperity lasting a decade, or the realm experiences a period of stability lasting a decade.

Rule5: If the king rules the realm wisely, then the following holds: provided that the realm experiences a period of stability lasting a decade, the realm experiences a period of peace lasting a decade.
Rule6: Either the king rules the realm wisely, or the king rules the realm strongly.

Rule7: If the monk, as a chronicler, records events of the realm, then the following holds: if it is not the case that a golden age of the realm lasting a century implies that strong rule by the king over the realm implies that stability of the realm for a decade implies peace of the realm for a decade, then the realm suffers a civil war.
Rule8: Either the vassal pays tribute to the king, or it is not the case that the king receives tribute from the vassal.
Rule9: The vassal revolts against the king, or the vassal negotiates with the king.
Rule10: If the vassal negotiates with the king, then the vassal does not pay tribute to the king.
Rule11: Under the condition that the baron supports the revolt of the vassal, the following holds: if the vassal revolts against the king, then the vassal does not pay tribute to the king.
Rule12: Whenever the king grants land to the baron, the baron swears fealty to the king.

Rule13: Provided that it is not the case that a golden age of the realm lasting a century implies that strong rule by the king over the realm implies that stability of the realm for a decade implies peace of the realm for a decade, it is not the case that the realm suffers a civil war.
Rule14: If it is not the case that the baron swearing fealty to the king implies that the king does not have an alliance with the council, then the king loses the support of the council.

Rule15: Provided that it is not the case that it is not the case that the king being crowned in the cathedral implies that the king holds the title of the duchy implies that the king does not have an alliance with the council, the king receives tribute from the vassal.
Rule16: If it is not the case that the king being crowned in the cathedral implies that the king holds the title of the duchy, then the king has an alliance with the council.
Rule17: Under the condition that it is not the case that the king being crowned in the cathedral implies that the king holds the title of the duchy, the king grants land to the baron.
Rule18: Provided that the king is not crowned in the cathedral, it is not the case that the king holds the title of the duchy.
facts: Fact1: The king secures an alliance with the council.
Fact2: The realm enjoys a golden age lasting a century.
Fact3: The monk, as a chronicler, records events of the realm.
Fact4: The baron supports the revolt of the vassal.

question: The king is crowned in the cathedral.
